page.title: 02CURRIE EDUCATION
page.content: Nicola Blyth and Fiona Sharry, interviewed headteacher Mrs B of Riccarton Primary.She has worked for six years and enjoys it. She has always wanted to be a teacher but not really a head one. Riccarton School is sixteen years old and has its own uniform and a school badge which represents a key. There are ten classes in the school,twenty six pupils to one class and two hundred and eighty two children in the school. The school goes on a lot of educational excursions. The school has a dinner area and a packed lunch area. Her lunch break goes on for one hour. They have a computer for the school and the children love it. Mrs B never gets bored she just gets a little frustrated. Mrs B likes to play golf in her spare time and reads a lot too. She enjoys music and the violin.
